job_title: Food Service Worker in Victoria, BC
pros: You get to work with a very nice and open-minded team, helping serve Canadian Veterans with a smile on your face! Most of the residents are very nice and welcoming, it made me very happy to be able to serve and accommodate for them. The staff are very helpful, welcoming, and are very willing to teach others! I was started as an Auxiliary Food Service worker, and ended up training in every position available in Food Service, and even as an Administrator in Environmental Services, which gave me an opportunity to learn invoice processing, medical inventory management, and independently work on my own.
cons: During my time with BCS, a shortage of staff makes for a stressful day all around the building. If you struggle with time management and efficiency, you may have a big learning curve in this position.

job_title: Licensed Practical Nurse in Victoria, BC
pros:
